items.content:
Foundation Coordinator – Australia at Atlassian

Remote | International | Part-time

Sydney, Australia

G&A

Part Time

Job description

Do you want to be part of an incredible company and know that you’re making a difference every single day? The Atlassian Foundation is looking for a passionate coordinator, working remotely anywhere in Australia. You will bring a consider-it-done attitude to the role, and have the ability to complete tasks to a high standard.

Our team has set some big hairy audacious goals to see change within our lifetime, and we can’t do it without you, a knowledgeable and expert administration aficionado. You will have a real passion for all things philanthropy. We are on the look out for someone with an excellent ability to prioritise, forward plan, take ownership, join the dots, see the bigger picture and demonstrable out-of-the-box analytical skills. You will be the master of the pivot table, with an eye for detail when working with data. Booking a meeting – no problem, you know all the right steps to ensure everyone attends and how to ensure the pre-work has been done to make it productive. Without your admin savvy, board meetings just wouldn’t run as smoothly. You always go above and beyond because you know your role makes the Foundation hum. You’re crazy about attention to detail, because your mantra is, “It’s the small things that make it possible to achieve the big things.”

With our foundation work happening in most of our cross-geographical locations, our goal is to find people within a 6-hour timezone overlap of Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST) to allow for virtual meetings

In this role:

  • You will assist with governance administration, including booking and organizing board meetings and drafting agendas
  • You are going to look after financial matters, which includes logging and managing expenses and processing payments
  • You will ensure smooth and organized event logistics, booking flights for team travel, and updating everyone on accommodation and flight details
  • You get to update the Foundation’s websites and provide timely answers to internal and external queries
  • You will own the administration of our monitoring and evaluation systems and updating of Foundation statistics

On your first day, we will expect that:

  • You have experience and background in a financial, administrative, or related function
  • You are proficient in Excel and able to generate reports using macros and pivot tables
  • You have the proven ability to work independently and can thrive in a remote-work set-up, collaborate with remote teams, and demonstrate ownership and self-sufficiency for administrative projects
  • You are someone who can communicate articulately and creatively through various platforms
  • You possess advanced MS Office skills, and experience using Google Calendar, Zoom or any other video conferencing tools

It’s also great if:

  • You have experience using technologies such as Jira, Confluence, and Trello or any similar software
  • You have experience writing blogs and copy-editing skills

More about our team

The Atlassian Foundation has nine members from all over the world – San Francisco, New York, Sydney, Manila, Bengaluru, and Adelaide. We believe we have a responsibility to tackle disadvantage both locally (the communities where we work) and globally. We also believe in the transformational power of both education and business as forces for good. Our team has three pillars:

“EDUCATE”

  • We team up to help educate 10 million disadvantaged youth within 10 years – preparing them for the workforce of the future

“ENLIST”

  • We bring out the best of business, by building the Pledge 1% movement

“ENERGISE”

  • Every Atlassian has the opportunity to Make A Difference Every day as part of their work (“MADE @ Atlassian”). We’re supporting Atlassians to contribute to local communities in the way they choose.

More about our benefits

Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favourite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning and growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more.

Location: Anywhere in Australia

Apply for job

items.title: Customer Experience Associate
items.content:
Customer Experience Associate at Peerspace

Remote | Entry-level

REMOTE

BUSINESS

FULL-TIME

Peerspace is creating a world where it’s easy to bring people together, starting with making it easy to find the perfect place to meet, create, and celebrate with others. Our Airbnb-like marketplace uncovers the world’s most unique spaces – like lofts, rooftops, and art galleries – and makes them ready to use for meetings, events, even filmshoots.

Over 3 million people have come together in a Peerspace, and we’re looking for people who want to help us reach the next 10 million.

Peerspace is looking for a customer support and escalations professional to join the growing Operations Team. This position offers a fantastic opportunity to learn about our marketplace and provide an exceptional experience for our hosts and guests that book space with us. Our team drives revenue and makes an immediate impact on our product through customer insights. This is a Wednesday to Sunday schedule where one can work remotely.

Opportunity:

  • Help build our customer support and success processes from the ground up, which means that there is no task too small nor too big for you to tackle
  • Provide friendly and efficient service to Peerspace hosts and guests to make sure they have a seamless, no-hassle booking experience
  • Identify and execute on opportunities to surprise and delight our hosts and guests
  • You will serve as a first point of contact for onboarding hosts or recommending locations and services to guests
  • Engage customers thoughtfully and professionally via existing and support channels (phone, email, live chat, etc.)
  • Drive improvements in the customer experience and our internal workflow

Requirements:

  • A passion for problem solving, interacting with customers, and teaching best practices to others on the team
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Comfort in prioritizing across potentially competing opportunities / demands
  • Technical aptitude and the ability to pick up new technology quickly
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited University

Bonus Skills:

  • Enthusiasm for and experience with improving customer satisfaction and loyalty across broad functional areas and diverse geographies.
  • Familiarity with CRM systems (i.e. Zendesk, Salesforce IQ, Salesforce)
  • Previous, demonstrable experience with crafting online help resources
  • Previous experience with sales
  • Event planning skills

Benefits:

  • Join a team reshaping a $500B industry
  • Competitive salary with employee stock options and access to a 401k
  • Medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Take-it-when-you-need-it vacation and sick days
  • A flexible work environment
  • Dog-friendly office
  • Weekly catered lunch
  • $500 annual professional development allowance
  • 20% discount on all Peerspace bookings

About Us:

Peerspace is a community marketplace that makes planning gatherings – starting with finding the perfect space – simple. Whether it’s a loft for a party, a rooftop for a film shoot, or an art gallery for a meeting, Peerspace empowers people to create one-of-a-kind experiences at any price point. As a community marketplace, Peerspace makes it easy for individuals and businesses to monetize their underused space and share it with an audience of millions.

Founded in April of 2014, Peerspace is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in Los Angeles, New York, and Chicago. The company’s investors include Foundation Capital, Structure Capital, Red Bridge Partners, and 31VENTURES.

Apply for job
